result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan Jon Herrick

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:30 PM 
Calling cases 22CM285, 22CM286, 22CM297
Defendant Bryan Jon Herrick in court with Attorney Ryan Reid.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews file; initial appearances on all matters. 
Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading in each file. Not guilty plea(s) entered in each file.
Court quashes warrants in the two files; questions non appearance
Attorney Reid has no information.
State requesting $500cb in each file.  22CM285 No contact with Walmart, 22CM286-No contact with Autozone, 22CM297-No contact with Kwik Trip.
Reviews priors bail jumpings, theft, FTA with a return over a year later, resist/obs FTA's x2, MN dis conduct w FTA-warrant status over 4 years in that matter.
Attorney Reid requesting signature bond in the alternative 50-100cb each file, local resident, family ties.
Court reviews concerns; Orders $500cb in each file. Conditions Ordered-22CM285 No contact with Walmart, 22CM286-No contact with Autozone, 22CM297-No contact with Kwik Trip Stores.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:02 PM Defendant Bryan Jon Herrick not in court. Attorney Chad LaLor appears for the State of Wisconsin
Defendant was given rta sheet with today's date and time for both files.  
State requests warrants in both files and forf of any bail/bond. Douglas, adjoining and Ashland.
Court orders warrant/forf bail or bond.
